ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Is it safe to sing AE songs in dungeons now?
ygData.msgSnippet: I use it when I m familiar with the area.  And yes, in LGuk, I am of the opinion that on the rare chance you do hit something outside the immediate area,
ygData.messageBody:
I use it when I'm familiar with the area. And yes, in LGuk, I am of the
opinion that on the rare chance you do hit something outside the immediate
area, that's just one more mob for your group (asuming someone doesn't grab
it as it's pathing to you.)

The Assassin's room I might avoid, since there are other multi-levels there.
But that area (garg area to savant room to cavalier room to the area just
below the garg area) would be the only place I would think twice about using
an ae song in an overpopulated lguk.

Darkfox Reven'tsol
Xegony


>
> With overcrowding a problem on almost every server, I'm wondering if it is
> now safe to add these songs back to our playlist. Months ago when
> overcrowding wasn't as big a problem, singing AE songs in a dungeon zone
was
> suicide because you were likely to start a massive train due to the z-axis
> bug. Nowadays, mobs in zones like LGuk are pulled usually within seconds
> after they spawn.
>
> Case in point. Last Friday I was camping the assasin room in LGuk for
over
> four hours. There was at least 70 people in the zone at all times. We
> often had 5-10 minutes of downtime in between fights because we couldn't
> find anything to pull. I strongly considered singing DDD (still need to
max
> my brass skill:-) but could not convince my group that it was safe to do
so.
> I even used the argument that in the rare event it did aggro a mob behind
a
> wall, since there were relatively few mobs on track we should be able to
> avoid starting a train. It might have even been useful in helping us
pull.
> That argument didn't work either and we ended up having a lot of downtime.
>
> Opinions?
>
> Galtin of E'ci
> 35 bard
